title: How to refer to the latest months of a year? What is the opposite of earlier this year - Quora

response.answer_text: Since autumn begins on September 21 and runs until December 20, you can call them “autumn.” I sometimes call them the “ember” months because three of them (September, November, and December) end in -ember. Of course, if you mean merely “the last few months” of any given 12-month period, then just use “the last few months of the year.”
Earlier today I made an appointment. Later today I shall keep it. Earlier this year I took up my present job. Later this year I may apply for leave. Use the opposite in both cases.
